name: sublimity
content:

the quality of being extremely good, beautiful, or enjoyable: The vistas of mountains satisfy a desire for grandeur and sublimity. From his photographs we get a sense of the awe and sublimity of nature. See
sublime
More examplesFewer examplesHe preached the sublimity of liberty and yet was a slave owner. The sublimity of the book's subject matter is matched by the sustained beauty of its language. The director created a contrast between the sublimity of the music and the plain and undramatised rendering of Bach's world.
